Rulings.Tengu:
● "Solemn Warning" can be activated during the Damage Step.

● "Solemn Warning" can negate the activation of Spell/Trap cards that would Special Summon (e.g. "Monster Reborn", "Call of the Haunted").

● "Solemn Warning" can negate the activation of monster effects that would Special Summon (e.g. "Forumula Synchron", "Tour Guide from the Underworld", "Reborn Tengu").

● "Solemn Warning" can negate an inherent summon in the summon negation window (e.g. "Black Luster Soldier, Envoy of the Beginning", "Master Hyperion", "XX-Saber Faultroll", or any inherent normal summon).

● "Solemn Warning" cannot negate the activation of a Spell/Trap effect that would Special Summon (e.g. "Infernity Launcher", "Geartown").

● "Solemn Warning" cannot negate the summon of a monster summoned by card effect, it has to negate the effect itself (e.g. "Monster Reborn", "Formula Synchron". This also means it cannot stop a normal summon performed by "Ultimate Offering" or "Mausoleum of the Emperer").

Rulings.Base:
1. You cannot negate the activation of a card that cannot Special Summon a monster, such as "Lightning Vortex".
2. You can negate the activation of "Macro Cosmos" with this card.
3. [FORUM] Since this card is a Counter Trap Card, so it can be activated in the Damage Step, such as when the effect of "Gorz the Emissary of Darkness" is activated.
4. [FORUM] You would not be able to activate a 2nd copy of "Solemn Warning" to negate a summon. One of the basic rules of Counter Trap Cards is that they must be activated in the Chain link just after the effect it is trying to counter. For example, the following chain to negate a Summon is not legal: "Solemn Warning" -> "Seven Tools of the Bandit" -> "Solemn Warning"
5. [FORUM] In order to negate a Summon through an effect, you would have to chain "Solemn Warning" to the activation of the effect that is Special Summoning a Monster. If you allow the effect to resolve, you are no longer able to chain "Solemn Warning".
